title: Riot fix this game...........
body: Just had a ranked game, and 2 people decided to just leave "afk" so it was a 3v5, can u at least make the queues fair, make the tribunal work properly and make it strict enough, as in 1 report = 1 warning, 3 reports 24 hour ban, yes i get it people abuse the system, but seriously why punish the ones actually trying to climb and wanting to play properly, yes i also get it there are way too many people playing this game and it needs a massive reset (ie. deleting the "main" accounts or other account which are not in use), putting them people who actually play often and properly in a certain "active" group, putting them people with reports in another group, putting the trolls and "special" people in another group, yes i know your going to say "oh thats why we have ranked for" and quite frankly its not a good enough excuse, make this game fair and not 1 sided and bias, make it everyone has a 50/50 chance and if they are actually good, make them progress give them something to work towards and not fuck up there chances, im not going to lie, this is an awesome game and all, and the people who actually play it to win are really good and friendly, but seriously fix it, get rid of the toxic people, get rid of the afk's, keep the unskilled because they have potential, but seriously most of all fix the dam ranked queues

Look man lets get serious here, it's great that you want this game to be better for everyone but your not providing many ideas and when you do they are extremely implausible or counter-productive. 

1. "_1 report = 1 warning, 3 reports 24 hour ban_" The only way that system would not be abused is if the tribunal was moderated by professionals, making at almost like a court with judges. And that would be too expensive in case you didn't notice. Furthermore AFKing can be the cause of multiple things not just toxicity therefore it cannot be judged so harshly.

2. Your idea of deleting accounts and placing people into groups is terrible. Honestly it sounds like Hitler's regime on a cyber scale. Deleting accounts is unfair to those who plan to come back (after completing Uni or sorting out their real life). 

3. "_putting the trolls and "special" people in another group_" You think it's that easy to distinguish who's a troll??? If it was we would just ban them. The truth is players just having bad days can look like toxic behaviour a lot of the time. Also what do you mean by "_special people_" ? Are you seriously suggesting we place disabled or bad players with trolls? That's so wrong on many levels...

4. "make it everyone has a 50/50 chance and if they are actually good" This is already the case. Assuming you are not a troll or AFK, there is a 44% chance that a troll is on your team, and a 56% chance that the enemy has one. Watch [this](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5MTO2a7ZFcc) video if you're still confused.

You have to just take the trolls with a grain of salt and move on from those games. Playing this game to win is a bad attitude, playing this game to improve will get you places.

Yes it would be too expensive. LOL in early 2014 had 27,000,000 daily players, this has most definitely increased since then, but since we have no more official figures to use, lets go off that.

Lets say that 5% of those players are being reported, that means every 2nd game will have one report. If OCE is really as toxic as you say, this shouldn't be an unrealistic figure.

0.05 x 27,000,000 = 1,350,000 reported players

Now that figure is only the number of reported players. So lets say they play again, and 50% of those players get reported again (these are the more toxic players)

1.350.000 x 1.5 = 675000 more reports

That's 2,025,000 reports total. Assuming they only play 2 games per day.

Say each report took 2.5 minutes on average to look-over/moderate (reading the chat, checking builds...). That would mean that in a 8 hour shift they could check 192 reports per person.

2,025,000 / 192 = 10547 (rounded to nearest whole number)

10,547 staff looking over reports everyday. The cost would be enormous, not to mention they would need to hire more staff during summer holidays in order to not fall behind on reports. You now understand how this is not possible?

They are working on a automated solution for bans, and I've already heard of many people in OCE being banned now. Sit tight I hear there's also updates to the report system next patch.
P.S Your referee system would be even more expensive. Because you need 24/7 service on all games.
